{"step_by_step_thinking": "Eteplirsen is a drug that has been approved by the FDA for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy in certain patients. It works by skipping exon 51 of the DMD gene, which allows for the production of a functional dystrophin protein. This can help to slow the progression of the disease. Therefore, it can be considered effective for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy in certain cases.", "answer_choice": "A"}
